Simple wrapper around cor.test for y ~ x style formula input

Source: R/cor_test.R
cor_test.Rd

Intended for use within the function tax_model

cor_test(formula, data, ...)

Arguments

formula

a formula in form y ~ x

data

dataframe

...

passed to cor.test

Examples

data("shao19")
ps <- shao19 %>%
  ps_filter(family_role == "mother") %>%
  tax_filter(min_prevalence = 20) %>%
  tax_agg("family")

cors <- ps %>% tax_model(
  rank = "family", variables = list("age", "number_reads"), type = cor_test
)
#> Warning: 25 / 174 values are NA in age
#> Modelling: Enterobacterales
#> Modelling: Bacteroidales
#> Modelling: Eubacteriales
#> Modelling: Clostridia class
#> Modelling: Bifidobacteriales
#> Modelling: Lactobacillales
#> Modelling: Coriobacteriales
#> Modelling: Firmicutes phylum
#> Modelling: Victivallales
#> Modelling: Erysipelotrichales
#> Modelling: Eggerthellales
#> Modelling: Veillonellales
#> Modelling: Desulfovibrionales
#> Modelling: Micrococcales
#> Modelling: Pasteurellales
#> Modelling: Acidaminococcales
#> Modelling: Verrucomicrobiales
#> Modelling: Burkholderiales
#> Modelling: Actinomycetales
#> Modelling: Proteobacteria phylum
#> Modelling: Methanobacteriales

tax_models_get(cors)
